article_title: FDA Sends Warning Letter After Kim Kardashian Touts Morning-Sickness Drug
article_text:
The Food and Drug Administration has long made clear that social-media remarks touting medical products can violate the law, so it quickly issued a warning recently when Kim Kardashian praised her morning-sickness drug on Instagram.

“OMG. Have you heard about this?” the ubiquitous celebrity asked her thousands of followers about the drug, Diclegis. “[I]t’s been studied and there was no increased risk to the baby. I’m so excited and...

twitter.description: The Food and Drug Administration said Kim Kardashian’s Instagram post praising her morning-sickness drug was “false or misleading in that it presents efficacy claims for Diclegis, but fails to communicate any risk information.
twitter.title: FDA Sends Warning Letter After Kim Kardashian Touts Morning-Sickness Drug

image.alt: FDA sends warning letter after Kim Kardashian touts morning-sickness drug

twitter.creator: @TomBurtonWSJ
